title: Guides
content:
The follow handbooks are available to help readers explore the policy questions underlying contract provisions and the issues crucial to understanding and negotiating mining and oil contracts, and to monitoring their enforcement.

Drawing from several of the contracts on ResourceContracts.org, "Mining Contracts: How to Read and Understand Them" was written in December 2013 to highlight strong contract clauses and explore how others could be improved. It goes beyond legal considerations to explore the policy questions and company interests underlying contract provisions—issues that are crucial for understanding and negotiating contracts, and for monitoring their enforcement.

Written by a group of world class oil experts and professionals, this book explains how to read the contracts which govern the oil industry. It was created in October 2012 using the same "book sprint" methodology as the Mining Contracts volume.

The law firm Allen and Overy has compiled guides to common terms in oil, gas and mining contracts, along with a wide range of information about the types of clauses used. The two guides respectively cover the mining sector and the oil and gas sector.
